samples.text: This is kinda where I'm at, but also fire is kinda part of the forests life cycle, but also can we actually affect the potential of old growth burning without being smoked in the face with unforseen consequences?

Not sure who in the Mullen Group comms area thought this would be a good look. Picking on a town devastated by a wildfire? We can have energy and care about our environment at the same time - both things can be true - unless you are Mullen i guess.

A quick little update to the Turnip28 rampart camp - I've started working on a tiny stove. Currently just blocking out the rough shape, I'll fill in the gaps with green stuff and possibly try to sculpt a tiny little tea pot

Key report takeaways Structure Density Matters In tightly packed areas, flames leapt from home to home. Connective Fuels Fuel Disaster Fences, decks, and landscaping allow fire spread to structures. Building Materials Can Make a Difference LAFires

To all the people saying, "it's cheaper", no it isn't, unless you have your own supply. Which is one reason why wood burning is predominantly done by wealthy or middle class people, poisoning themselves and poisoning others. www.theguardian.comenvironment...

Scotland, Northern Ireland, and England are all battling blazes - some started deliberately, some because someone couldn’t be bothered to take their rubbish home. This isn't just a warm weekend. This is a climate crisis on full blast.
Drax causes less harmful pollution than wood burning stoves. Here's the data to prove it youtu.behTqa8RHk5yM Also there's no residential properties within 1km of Drax.

You mean the town that burned down because of increasing wildfire hazards due to climate change?

It’s not about burning down everything, it’s about eliciting change before it’s too late. Were you in cali for the fires? That’s likely to happen this summer again next year across the globe. We’re in a climate catastrophe and there’s no time for the slow progress of 4 more years of it’s ok Joe!

This week’s project is my kitchen. I got a GreenPan Elite multi cooker. Since that POS flat cooktop is a menace I’m unplugging it from the wall and going with this new thing. That stove scares the Hell out of me. It CLICKS. Nope.

London has seen a large decrease in fires -30% and fire deaths -50% since 2009. Very much calls into question the value of the new single-stair rules samdumitriu.bsky.social onlinelibrary.wiley.comdoi10.1002...

My next door neighbour has many hectares of woodland people in our hamlet have a sustainable source of firewood. I'm installing a heat pump with PV too, but it gets too cold in the middle of winter here in the Massif Central, so a woodburner is basically essential.

every news story or fire service ranger service update about wildfires in Scotland on Facebook over the last few days has absolutely wild conspiracy theories under it. None of these even mention climate change, yet people utterly convinced they are a "false flag" etc
